item.title: Attribute Substitution
item.description: See the preamble to this post. The most obvious bias of Mr. System 1 is attribute substitution. As Danny Kanny puts it, we replace the hard questions which cannot be answered, by easy ones that we know the answers to thereby deceiving ourselves into believing that we’ve found the answers. For example, when we think about whether a person is guilty in a particular crime (a very difficult question) Mr. System 1 replaces it with whether the person is well-behaved and likely to have committed the crime (an easy question), our legal system tries to mitigate the influence of Mr.
